text: building regular modules is already a bummer (outside of React)
how much would loading large videos benefit by being in islands? Similar to lazy loading or any kind of extra benefit?
for example, a series of 5 video each 1-2MB each

:thinking_face: - The benefit to the "lazyness" of an island is about the browser deferring the JS modules required to hydrate and make interactive the island. I think you would still need to lazy load the video if the HTML is being rendered server side to defer the browser downloading the video.
If you were doing some shenanigans where you didn't want to render the video tag via island laziness ... I'm still not sure there would be any benefit to that vs a video tag with lazy loading.
+1 to <@UAYBXDG4U>â€™s points. My only caveat there is if the video required a heavy JS player library, then maybe islands could help
